wikipedia_page.main: Samuel Mark McLeod (4 January 1934 – 29 July 1973) was a Scottish professional footballer who played as a forward.

Manager Benny Fenton assembled his own squad for the 1955–56 season, bringing in goalkeeper Percy Ames from Tottenham Hotspur, while also signing a number of players from Scottish junior football including John Fowler, Bobby Hill and Sammy McLeod.

After playing his final game, Baines left United, joining local club Lexden Wanderers before emigrating to Australia. There, he played for South Australia, Port Adelaide, Lion SC and Elizabeth City, the latter managed by former U's player Sammy McLeod.
